member.name: T:ImageVault.Common.Data.Effects.UnsharpMaskEffect
member.summary: The UnsharpMaskEffect sharpens an image by first creating a blurred version of the image. For each pixel in the image, the difference between the original pixel value and the blurred pixel value is determined. If the difference in pixel values exceeds a threshold value, the original pixel value is modified, sharpening the image.

member.name: P:ImageVault.Common.Data.Effects.UnsharpMaskEffect.Radius
member.summary: Defines the width of the sharpening effect in pixels
member.remarks:
Sharpening works on the edges of a subject by increasing the contrast at these points, making these outlines stand out more prominently. The higher the Radius amount, the stronger the sharpening effect. Its measured in pixels, as this is the width of the sharpening effect.
Typical setting: 1-8 pixels
Good starting point: 1 pixel

member.name: P:ImageVault.Common.Data.Effects.UnsharpMaskEffect.Amount
member.summary: Defines the amount of sharpening to apply in pixels.

remarks.para: This is like a volume adjustment the higher the percentage, the stronger the sharpening effect.

member.name: P:ImageVault.Common.Data.Effects.UnsharpMaskEffect.Threshold
member.summary: Defines the threshold level of the sharpening effect.

remarks.para: The higher the threshold amount is set, the lower the sharpening effect. This value defines what counts as an edge for the sharpening applied by the and values. At '0 levels' each pixel counts as an edge, so it is sharpened. At high values (25 levels and above, for example) only high-contrast edges are sharpened.

member.name: M:ImageVault.Common.Data.Effects.UnsharpMaskEffect.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the UnsharpMaskEffect class.
member.remarks: Defaults to 1 pixel, 100 % and 5 levels

member.name: M:ImageVault.Common.Data.Effects.UnsharpMaskEffect.#ctor(System.Double,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the UnsharpMaskEffect class.

member.summary: Creates a new object that is a copy of the current instance.
member.returns: A new object that is a copy of this instance.

member.summary: Get/Sets the KeepAspectRatio of the MediaConversion
member.value: Will keep the original aspect ratio of the image if set to true. If false the image will be the aspect ratio of the target size. Default value is true
member.remarks: If the is set to anything else than zero, this value has no function since the aspect ratio is already set.

member.name: P:ImageVault.Common.Data.WebMediaFormat.AspectRatio
member.summary: Get/Sets the AspectRatio of the MediaConversion
member.value: Defines the aspect ratio of the image. If set the original image will automatically cropped to a size that matches the given aspect ratio (unless the original image already matches the given aspect ratio). Default value is zero. Zero disables the crop function, negative values are illegal.

The method will search for a subfolder called procedures and one called tables and execute all scripts in these folders. Scripts can be devided into 3 parts Pre, main and post installation. member.returns: True if installation was run successfully.

member.name: M:ImageVault.Common.Lib.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializerCache.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the object and optionally releases the managed resources.
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.
member.remarks: This method is called by the public Dispose() method and the Finalize method. Dispose() invokes the protected Dispose(Boolean) method with the disposing parameter set to true. Finalize invokes Dispose with disposing set to false. When the disposing parameter is true, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this object references. This method invokes the Dispose() method of each referenced object. Notes to Inheritors: Dispose can be called multiple times by other objects. When overriding Dispose(Boolean), be careful not to reference objects that have been previously disposed of in an earlier call to Dispose. For more information about how to implement Dispose(Boolean), see Implementing a Dispose Method. For more information about Dispose and Finalize, see Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources and Overriding the Finalize Method.

member.name: T:ImageVault.Common.P3PUtil
member.summary: P3P is (was) a standard for describing policies for websites http://www.w3.org/P3P/details.html IE 6-8? uses those headers for determining if cookies should be accepted when a page is loaded inside an iframe (depending on security level) This class tries to address this problem by inserting an acceptable header that allows ie to accept headers.
member.remarks:
The standard seems to not be in use anymore, a report states many sites that has incorrect policies or missing policies. http://www.cylab.cmu.edu/files/pdfs/tech_reports/CMUCyLab10014.pdf More information can also be found http://stackoverflow.com/questions/389456/cookie-blocked-not-saved-in-iframe-in-internet-explorer http://www.p3pwriter.com/LRN_111.asp
2013-10-16 dan: Created

member.name: M:ImageVault.Common.P3PUtil.AddP3PHeader(System.Web.HttpResponse,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a P3P header suitable for ImageVault
member.remarks: This is needed to allow IE keep cookies in iframes
member.param: The response to add the header to
The relative url for the policy ref document. If omitted /w3c/p3p.xml will be used.

member.name: T:ImageVault.Common.Security.OAuth.OAuthErrorCodes
member.summary: Defines the different types of error codes stated by the oauth2 rfc.

member.name: F:ImageVault.Common.Security.OAuth.OAuthErrorCodes.InvalidRequest
member.summary: The request is missing a required parameter, includes an unsupported parameter value (other than grant type), repeats a parameter, includes multiple credentials, utilizes more than one mechanism for authenticating the client, or is otherwise malformed.

member.name: F:ImageVault.Common.Security.OAuth.OAuthErrorCodes.InvalidClient
member.summary: Client authentication failed (e.g., unknown client, no client authentication included, or unsupported authentication method). The authorization server MAY return an HTTP 401 (Unauthorized) status code to indicate which HTTP authentication schemes are supported. If the client attempted to authenticate via the "Authorization" request header field, the authorization server MUST respond with an HTTP 401 (Unauthorized) status code and include the "WWW-Authenticate" response header field matching the authentication scheme used by the client.

member.name: F:ImageVault.Common.Security.OAuth.OAuthErrorCodes.InvalidGrant
member.summary: The provided authorization grant (e.g., authorization code, resource owner credentials) or refresh token is invalid, expired, revoked, does not match the redirection URI used in the authorization request, or was issued to another client.

member.name: F:ImageVault.Common.Security.OAuth.OAuthErrorCodes.UnauthorizedClient
member.summary: The authenticated client is not authorized to use this authorization grant type.

member.name: F:ImageVault.Common.Security.OAuth.OAuthErrorCodes.UnsupportedGrantType
member.summary: The authorization grant type is not supported by the authorization server.

member.name: F:ImageVault.Common.Security.OAuth.OAuthErrorCodes.InvalidScope
member.summary: The requested scope is invalid, unknown, malformed, or exceeds the scope granted by the resource owner.

member.name: F:ImageVault.Common.Security.OAuth.OAuthErrorCodes.UnsupportedResponseType
member.summary: The authorization server does not support obtaining an authorization code using this method.

member.name: F:ImageVault.Common.Security.OAuth.OAuthErrorCodes.AccessDenied
member.summary: The resource owner or authorization server denied the request.
